intro: Eurya panamensis, commonly known as the Panama eurya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly Panama, and grows in moist, shaded forest environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Eurya panamensis is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
